all right this review is on the latest
LP from the California band cake
the title is showroom of compassion it's
their first studio album since 2004's
pressure chief and last year on a blog
that i'll link you guys to in the d box
I had a write-up on the album which has
stayed in my collection longer than any
other album now if there's one band who
is seconded by that LP it is a cake with
their first four albums yes I proudly
own these to me cake is a band's band
every single instrument in the mix is
adding an essential contribution to this
really distinct sound that they have
that they've basically been riding since
the 90s and though I would never say
every band should aspire to sound like
cake I think things would be a little
bit more interesting if every band tried
to sound maybe as distinct as cake
because the thing is with these guys you
know who you're listening to in a snap
here it's cake as you've always heard
them these really prominent groovy bass
lines sharp guitars bright horns and
John McRae's pronouncing correctly thick
Basie vocal jammed right up there into
the microphone and the interplay between
these guys too is always a treat the
thing is even when their music is
heavily arranged and very planned out
they still sound like they're jamming
and there's talent here especially in
the storytelling which is pretty much
always what has attracted me to this
band who sure cake has written love
songs
relationship songs but there are so many
tracks that they have put together that
are so outside of the songwriting box
commissioning a symphony and see
meanwhile
Rick James opera singer the distance
Frank Sinatra stick shifts and safety
belts these are just a few
who the hell writes songs about this and
this tradition carries on to the
showroom of compassion with Italian guy
a really weird track talking about an
Italian guy in a pinstripe suit who's
nodding and squinting and nodding and
squinting and even though I feel like I
have nothing that makes me relate to
this song I am NOT this Italian guy I
don't know this Italian guy it creates
an image in my head that I just feel
glued to but also on the cell peak cake
makes a couple of attempts at writing
songs with words that are a little less
esoteric like the single here sick of
you which is really catchy can't deny
that but it's not exactly like the
lyrics are gonna jump off the page if
you were to write them out but musically
the album is really engaging strong
hooks great melodies great recording and
what I love is how cake can maintain a
style just maintain a sound while
jumping from genre to genre to genre on
the last track they go for some real
baroque pop instrumentation on bound
away they do a heavy heavy country thing
which I haven't heard them do to that
extent since their first LP motorcade of
generosity got some piano boundary on
the winter also a sultry instrumental on
teenage pregnancy just a few things that
stood out to me so overall this album is
just kind of cake being cake if you've
heard their previous stuff this will be
no surprise I promise the bad side of
cake basically sounding the same being
that same band for me is that the
question comes up does this LP fill a
void or fill an interest that their
previous five don't already do for me or
just those first four for me that
question is still kind of unanswered I
know I like it but will I come back to
it and I'm not going to know the answer
to that until I basically put this thing
down and maybe two weeks from now I'll
sit there thinking to myself humming a
song from this album saying damn that
cake album is good I want to go listen
to it again you've got to let something
go
and then you know it's true love if it
comes back right now I'm feeling a
decent seven on this thing it could grow
on me
but it's just decent pop music what are
you gonna do you guys know that I'm into
the experimental stuff I'm into the
noisy stuff I'm into the Avant stuff but
sometimes I just want to sit back and
chill and enjoy something simple and
sweet so if you guys have heard the LP
what did you think about it did you love
it
did you hate it why do we even like cake
do you hate cake is it just not for you

making a review with absolutely no
